slides.title: Problem 1 – Uniform Acceleration
slides.html_body:
Problem 1

A car accelerates from rest at 3 m/s² for 5 s. Find the final speed.

Solution

Using v = u + at, with u = 0, a = 3, t = 5 → v = 15 m/s.

slides.title: Problem 2 – Inclined Plane Dynamics
slides.html_body:
Problem 2

A 2 kg block slides down a 30° incline with μ_k = 0.15. Compute the acceleration.

Solution

Net force = mg·sinθ – μ_k·mg·cosθ → a = (g(sinθ – μ_k cosθ)) ≈ 6.08 m/s².

slides.title: Problem 3 – Newton’s Second Law
slides.html_body:
Problem 3

Two carts (3 kg & 5 kg) collide inelastically. After collision they move together at 3 m/s. Find the initial speed of the 5 kg cart.

Solution

Momentum conservation: 3·4 + 5·v = (3+5)·3 → v = 2 m/s.

slides.title: Problem 4 – Conservation of Energy
slides.html_body:
Problem 4

A projectile is launched at 20 m/s at 40°. Determine its maximum height.

Solution

v_y = v·sinθ = 20·sin40° ≈ 12.86 m/s. Height = v_y²/(2g) ≈ 8.4 m.
